Title: The Supply of Taxis (driver and escort where required) Coaches and Mini Buses
Description:
Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council invited tenders for the supply of taxis, (including escort when required) Coaches and Mini Buses for home to school, social needs, staff and member travel. The majority of travel will take place within the confines of the Borough boundaries but out of the Borough travel will be required within the framework

Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council has implemented the framework agreement with contracts awarded on a cascading basis to those suppliers who can provide the service based on the most economically advantageous submission and best meet the requirements of the Council.  The successful suppliers will be able to supply transport in the categories listed below:

•	4 Passenger taxi 
•	5 Passenger taxi 
•	5-8 Passenger taxi 
•	8-16 Passenger Bus 

Note all the above requirements to be supplied with or without an escort

Title: Evaluation of Tameside and Glossop Transformation Schemes
Description:
The Care Together Programme is Tameside and Glossop's approach to health and social care transformation.  As part of the programme the health economy received £23.4m in funding from the Greater Manchester Health and Social Care Partnership (GMHSCP) to deliver a series of transformation schemes.  Care Together is a partnership between.
•	Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council (TMBC)
•	Tameside and Glossop Integrated NHS Care Foundation Trust (ICFT)
•	Tameside and Glossop Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG)
The Care Together Programme has the following stated aims: 
•	To improve the Healthy life expectancy (HLE) through implementing a place based approach to better prosperity, health and well being
•	To deliver a clinically and financially sustainable health economy within five years
The expected returns of the investment outlined above (both qualitative and financial) are detailed in the Investment Agreement.  The Care Together Partnership is looking for an independent evaluation partner to assess the success and achievement of the programme.  
The evaluation will provide an objective assessment of the impact of our transformation programmes and take account of some of the challenges involved in measuring an interdependent set of activities, many of which are designed to affect similar population groups.  This specification provides further context and criteria against which providers should prepare their proposals.   
To Express and Interest and access all supporting information in relation to this opportunity, please register your organisation on The Chest
All correspondence in relation to this opportunity is to be made via https://www.the-chest.org.uk/

Please do not email/call Tameside MBC staff direct.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [The University of Manchester|M13 5SS|NONE||Yes|No]

Title: The Provision of Direct Payment Support Service
Description:
Tender for the Provision of Direct Payment Support Service

Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council is committed to the provision of high quality services to enable people to live in their own homes.

Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council (Adult Services), are inviting expressions of interest in the above tender, this is an open tender previously advertised in OJEU since 27 July 2017.

The contract is for a period of five years and will commence 1 November 2017.
Direct Payments are an alternative to traditional care and support services.  The Council provides cash payments for individual Service Users to purchase services that meet their assessed care needs.  This gives the person receiving services more choice and control over how their care needs are met.  Recipients of Direct Payments can choose to employ their own care workers known as Personal Assistants (PAs) or to buy services from a provider or a mixture of the two.   
In providing Direct Payments, local authorities are also expected to provide a service to support those who need assistance in managing their Direct Payments. 

We are looking for providers to deliver all of the following :-

A.	Standard Payroll service
B.	Managed Accounts service with Payroll
C.	Managed Accounts service without Payroll

NB - The Council MAY be implementing payment cards to help Service Users manage funds and this may reduce the need for Managed Accounts Services in the future. This will be coordinated with the successful provider and the contract amount specific to managed accounts will at this point be excluded from the contract.
The current level of service is; 

255 Service Users in Total of these -
102 Managed Accounts with Payroll
39 Invoice only Managed Accounts (managed accounts without payroll)
114 Standard Accounts

327 Payslips per month 

These figures may fluctuate but the provider will be expected to manage the fluctuation within the total budget. If the fluctuations are consistently either increasing or decreasing over a period of time this will be reviewed with the successful provider. 

The maximum first year budget is £65,000 (Please note that any tendering organisation submitting a first year contract price greater than this will not have their tender considered)

All documentation must be completed and submitted electronically www.the-chest.org.uk by the due date of 1 September 2017 12 noon.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Paypartners Limited|3rd Floor, Lancastrian Office Centre, Talbot Road, Stretford, Manchester, M32 0FP|||No|No]

Title: Local Registers of Brownfield Land: Advice to Local Authorities
Description:
DCLG requires assistance and expertise to develop and quality assure appropriate guidance and standards for Local Authorities to prepare and release their local brownfield land registers in fully open, accessible and standardised forms.  This will include communications and engagement with Local Authorities via workshops in separate geographic locations.

Specific objectives are to assist DCLG to: 

•	Develop, quality-assure and publish technical guidance and national data standards. 

•	Design, organise and facilitate 3 workshops to be held in June/July to promote the guidance/national data standard and address questions from authorities.

•	Capture feedback and key issues arising from the workshops for DCLG to disseminate separately. 

A memorandum of understanding has therefore been agreed with Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council.

Title: Accommodation based support for Domestic Abuse
Description:
This proposal is submitted by Tameside MBC (Directorate of Place) on behalf of Tameside, Stockport and Oldham Councils and will work across the three boroughs. For further information or to express an interest full details can be found on the CHEST North West procurement portal https://www.the-chest.org.uk/ 

The proposal incorporates 2 elements.

•	Firstly enabling access to crisis support for one of the most excluded groups i.e. for women affected by domestic abuse and with no recourse to public funds. 
•	Secondly providing access direct into permanent homes for households experiencing severe and multiple disadvantage.  

This proposal is an exciting opportunity to provide an effective service for those who are victims of domestic violence and abuse and coping with multiple disadvantages. This service will act on a model of 'Housing First' accommodation and support.  It will ensure we are directing services to establish lasting independence, housing victims of domestic violence and abuse and their families in a community, rather than a temporary refuge, and wrapping around specialist and intensive support. This type of provision is not currently available in any of our boroughs on a housing first basis.  

The defined cohort places a high cost on criminal justice and health services. This approach will bring transformational change to the way that we commission services to respond to domestic violence and abuse across the 3 authorities. 

The purpose of this Service is to integrate the functions and services that are required to support victims of domestic abuse and navigate through their needs using both the Service and the network of other existing services and help that is available to allow the client to become independent.

This contract is planned to run for a period of 1 year commencing in Autumn 2017.
The value of the contract is £193,000.
For further information or to express an interest full details can be found on the CHEST North West procurement portal https://www.the-chest.org.uk/

Title: NOT AWARDED (TENDER FOR THE PROVISION OF  RESPITE CARE FOR ADULTS WITH A LEARNING DISABILITY AND ADDITIONAL NEEDS SUCH AS PHYSICAL/ SENSORY/MENTAL HEALTH WITHIN A REGISTERED  CARE HOME SETTING.)
Description:
?	Provision of a respite service for adults with a learning disability and additional needs such as physical/sensory/mental health within a registered care home setting.
?	The registered care home setting will have provision for four beds and one additional emergency bed and will be located in the borough of Tameside.
?	The provision will deliver care/support within a registered care home setting that will offer accommodation that is a stand-alone facility/build or offers a separate annexe within a larger home. In addition to the number of beds detailed above, the facility will have a lounge and dining area, adapted bathroom and appropriate equipment which may include hoists, bath chair, grab rails etc. This list is not exhaustive.
?	Provision 24-hours a day including a waking night, operating 365 days a year for individuals who, for the majority of the time, live in the parental/family home.
?	To deliver a service model of care/support that meets individuals daily living needs including the provision of personal care, meals and drinks. The service will support positive risk taking to allow individuals? to meet these needs. 
?	The provider will deliver appropriate staffing levels within the accommodation to meet the diverse range of learning disability and additional needs and demand for the Service including the emergency placement. The provider will manage this delivery within the maximum budget specified within this contract.  
?	Bookings for the service will be co-ordinated by the provider based on the number of nights allocations per annum per service user as identified through the purchasers assessment of need.  
?	For information, the current useage as of March 2016 is 59 service users. The total number of allocated bed nights per annum for October 2015 to September 2016 is 1448.

Title: Inspection, servicing, maintenance and repair of straight and curved stair lifts, vertical through floor lifts, step lifts and overhead track hoists
Description:
This tender is for the provision of an annual schedule of service and inspection of all straight and curved stair lifts, vertical lifts, step lifts (internal and external) and overhead track hoists (hereafter known as the appliances), installed in domestic properties in Tameside and Oldham that no longer fall within a manufacturer's warranty. This includes provision of minor repairs where necessary, arising out of annual service and inspection. The cost of minor repairs will be up to and including £350. Repairs arising from scheduled inspection and service costing more than £350 are to be included as part of the emergency call out service. 

In addition, the Contractor shall provide a full call-out facility covering 24 hours each day and 365 days a year, (including Christmas Day, Boxing Day and New Year's Day).

Title: Contract for the provison of a Breastfeeding Peer Support Service
Description:
Breastfeeding Peer Support Programme will contribute to promoting a social and cultural shift where breastfeeding is viewed as the conventional way to feed a baby. The Department of Health recommend exclusive breastfeeding for the first 6 months as providing optimum nutrition for babies with the gradual introduction of solid food after this time in tune with the baby's developmental progress.
Parents can benefit from, early, evidence based information in order to enable them to make an informed infant feeding choice.    Proactive, intensive, and early skilled support in breastfeeding management helps to prevent  any problems and/or barriers that lead to mothers stopping breastfeeding earlier than they or their baby would have wished.
Contact Address 1: Please refer to details in the Tender Pack

Title: Tender for Greater Manchester Tobacco Control and Alcohol Harm Reduction Programme
Description: Greater Manchester Public Health Network (GMPHN) is a collaborative organisation that works on behalf of the Directors of Public Health from the 10 Greater Manchester local authorities to ensure that public health has a strong and credible voice with local, regional and national partners. GMPHN provides additional support and capacity to Public Health teams in the GM local authorities and establishes and manages Greater Manchester programmes of work that aim to:   · Secure improved outcomes against the Public Health Outcomes Framework.  · Increase the number of healthy years experienced by local populations. · Articulate and secure support for changes in national policy to reduce the risk of future dependency on high cost services. · Facilitate the use of best practice and innovation in public health practice. · Contribute to local public service reform programmes and the devolution of Health & Social Care in Greater Manchester.    Tameside MBC / GMPHN is looking to contract with a provider or consortia to develop and operate a flexible, innovative and comprehensive Greater Manchester Tobacco Control and Alcohol Harm Reduction programme that is focussed on and meets the needs of people in Greater Manchester.    The purpose of the service is to reduce tobacco and alcohol related harm and reduce health inequalities across Greater Manchester by:    · Reducing tobacco related harm. · Contributing to the achievement of local smoking prevalence outcomes, breaking the cycle of children and young people's addiction and exposure to tobacco.  · Reduce alcohol related harm.  · Contribute to the achievement of local alcohol plans and reducing the visibility of advertising - especially to children and young people. · Develop and implement campaigns that secure changes to individual behaviours, societal norms and national legislation.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Tobacco Free Futures|5 Adair Street, Manchester, Greater Manchester, M1 2NQ|||No|No]

Title: Specialist Day Services for People with Dementia
Description:
The service is aimed at providing daytime support and activities to those people with a diagnosis of dementia whose needs are such that they are best met by a service able to provide a level of specialist support not readily available in mainstream or other social care settings.
The service will provide support to Service Users ordinarily resident in the borough.
The service will utilise a single building, Wilshaw House, Ashton-under-Lyne, in delivering that part of the service that is required to be building-based. Wilshaw House is owned and maintained by the commissioner and other local authority functions may take place elsewhere within the buildings. There is no expectation that the Provider will be charged rent
	
While part of the service will be building-based, there will also be flexible and responsive person-centred support for Service Users to access and engage with external mainstream and community facilities.

This could be either in small groups or as individual integrated activities, wherever this is possible or practicable.
The Provider will provide up to 140 building-based places per week as an indicative figure. Other Service Users will be supported to utilise a community day service element that would provide an additional eight day places, seven days a week, ie another 56 weekly places, giving a combined total of 196 places a week. 
As a consequence of the severity and progress of their dementia, some Service Users are likely to require assistance with aspects of personal care.
The Provider will need to make provision for the arrangement of the safe and reliable transport of Service Users to and from the Service, where Service Users require it. The catchment area could include any part of the borough. Transport may require the use of a mini bus or mini buses of a number to be agreed, which the Provider will be responsible for providing and maintaining. Support Staff will drive and act as escort on these buses. 
Meals make a major contribution to Service Users' participation in and enjoyment of daily living routines. Mealtimes are recognised as an important social occasion, as well as being an important and necessary element in the routine of some Service Users. The Provider will ensure that meals are available to all Service Users on a flexible basis. For example, some Service Users will prefer a hot, lunchtime meal as their choice. For further details please refer to https://www.the-chest.org.uk/

Title: Fairlea Embankment Remedial Works
Description:
Description of Proposed Works

The Fairlea Embankment Remedial Works involves the following: 

Enabling Works
Enabling works to access the embankment and establish the site compound. The suggested site compound location is at the east end of Fairlea to the greenspace adjacent to property number 24. It is suggested that a serviceable path is established along the top of the embankment to enable the works to be carried out.

The working area includes private gardens at high level, the embankment and the banks of the stream at the lower level of the embankment. Serviceable access for site staff to all of these areas should be established before works begin. Agreements between TMBC, the Contractor and the private land owners shall be in place prior to the commencement of works. 

Upon completion of the works, private gardens (Properties No. 26-29) and the boundary fence line are to be reinstated to pre-failure condition. A new garden boundary fence is to be installed as part of the works.

Notice Identifier: CR/CORP/LCC/18/835 - UPDATED (Please see 'Additional Text' field below.)
Title: LPS CORP - Provision Of A Food Distribution Network To Lancashire County Council
Description:
The Purchaser (LCC) is inviting tenders on the terms set out in this ITT to secure a single supplier framework for the distribution of food and drink products including the supply and delivery of fresh fruit, vegetables and salad products to over 500 LCC units, including schools, care homes, day centres and civic units.

The contracted distributor will be responsible for the supply and delivery of fresh fruit, vegetable and salad products and will also be responsible for the distribution of subsequent food and drink supply contracts that will be created prior to and throughout the duration of the framework agreement. 

The Duration of the Framework Agreement will be for an initial period of 3 years. With the option to extend for any given period up to a further 12 months.

LCC wishes to establish this framework (where the successful Tenderer's capacity and capability permits) as accessible for use by other public sector bodies including:

• Blackburn with Darwen Borough Council
• Blackpool Borough Council
• Bolton Metropolitan Borough Council 
• Burnley Borough Council
• Bury Metropolitan Borough Council
• Chorley Borough Council
• Fylde Borough Council
• Hyndburn Borough Council
• Lancaster City Council
• Manchester City Council
• Oldham Metropolitan Borough Council
• Pendle Borough Council
• Preston City Council
• Ribble Valley Borough Council
• Rochdale Metropolitan Borough Council
• Rossendale Borough Council
• Salford City Council
• South Ribble Borough Council
• Stockport Metropolitan Borough Council
• Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council
• Trafford Metropolitan Borough Council
• West Lancashire Borough Council
• Wigan Metropolitan Borough Council
• Wyre Borough Council
• Lancashire schools, colleges and academies: 



The framework is estimated to be between £3,000,000 and £5,000,000 per annum based on LCC's recent historical data. 

The value of participation by the wider public sector for the maximum 4 year is not guaranteed and an estimated figure is provided - The estimated range is between £0 to £1,500,000 per annum over the maximum 4 years of the agreement (£6,000,000 in total)

Therefore for the duration of the Framework Agreement (including the extension period) the anticipated total framework value is estimated to be between £12,000,000 and £26,000,000

Tenderers should note the value of the framework may fluctuate and total value is not guaranteed.
Contact Address 1: Lancashire County Council, 2nd Floor Christ Church Precinct
Additional Text:
A supplier information day for Tenderers will be held on the 29th October 2018 at 14:00, County Hall, Preston, PR1 0LD. All Tenderers are open to attend and are asked to meet at the Pitt Street reception entrance to County Hall, 10 minutes prior to the meeting commencing.

Please confirm if you would be interested in attending by emailing contractscorporate@lancashire.gov.uk by no later than Friday 26th October, with the subject "Distribution Network Information Day - Attendance".

Description:
Lancashire County Council is inviting tenders on the terms set out in this ITT to secure a multi-lotted framework agreement for the provision of fresh (non-halal) meat products.

Ralph Livesey Ltd
Fresh Food Distribution Hub,
Unit 72B, Roman Way,
Off Longridge Road,
Preston,
PR2 5BE

Deliveries of the products supplied will then be made by the distributor to over 400 primary schools county-wide.

Lot 2 - Lancashire County Council is inviting tenders to secure a single supplier framework agreement for the supply and direct delivery of fresh (non-halal) meat products into over 50 county council units, the majority of these being high schools and care homes.                                                                                                                                          

The duration of the Framework Agreement for both lots will be for an initial period of 2 years, with the option to extend for any given period up to maximum of a further 24 months.

The value of participation by the wider public sector for the maximum 4 years is estimated to be between £0 to £415,350 per annum (£1,661,400 maximum over 4 years).

The framework value (Lot 2) is estimated to be between £191,000 to £229,000 per annum for Lancashire County Council Spend (£764,000 to £916,000 over 4 years).

The value of participation by the wider public sector for the maximum 4 years is estimated to be between £0 to £169,650 per annum (£678,600 maximum over 4 years)

Title: AGMA Electoral Printing Services
Description: Trafford Metropolitan Borough Council ("the Council") is inviting responses for a collaborative contract for election printing and graphics services. The framework agreement will initially be for, but not limited to, the use of Bolton Metropolitan Council, Bury Metropolitan Council, Manchester City Council, Oldham Metropolitan Council, Salford City Council, Stockport Metropolitan Borough Council, Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council, Trafford Metropolitan Borough Council, Wigan Metropolitan Borough Council. The Contract will be for a term of 2 years; from January 2019 till January 2021, and potentially it may be extended for a further period of 24 months annually up to January 2023. Indicative Elections timetable The elections anticipated to take place during the next three to four years are: 2 May 2019 Local Elections 7 May 2020 ALL-OUT Local Elections 7 May 2020 GM Mayor Election 7 May 2020 City Mayor Election 5 May 2022 Local Elections 5 May 2022 General Election It is critical that production, delivery and despatch schedules are met by the supplier. The supplier must be able to deliver artwork which fully complies with legal requirements as specified by the Returning Officer (RO)/ Electoral Registration Officer (ERO).

Title: Weather Forecast Services
Description:
Rochdale Borough Council, acting on behalf of itself and the nine other Greater Manchester Authorities, are seeking to appoint a winter highways weather forecasting service supplier with appropriate skills and resource available to undertake the exacting requirements of the AGMA winter maintenance group (AGMA). 
The Ten Greater Manchester Authorities include:-
Bolton Council
Bury Council
Manchester City Council
Oldham Metropolitan Borough Council
Rochdale Metropolitan Borough Council
Salford City Council
Stockport Metropolitan Borough Council
Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council
Trafford Council
Wigan Council
To maintain the highway network in as safe a condition as possible for its users during adverse weather events has required a combination of technical skills allied to accurate weather forecasts to enable decision makers to plan and implement effective treatments of the highway.  It is therefore very important that weather forecasts can be shown to meet the standards of accuracy and quality for a contract of this type.
Additional Text: Please do not contact the buyer directly, please use the above link to see the advertised opportunity. Any questions must also be facilitated through the message and answer facility via the CHEST.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [MetDesk Limited|HP22 6BN|NONE||Yes|No]

Title: Inter-Country Adoption Pre-Assessment Service
Description:
This contract is to provide a direct delivery service of Pre-Assessment for Inter Country Adoption (ICA).

The Provider would be required to deal with all ICA queries that are made from the list of Local Authorities listed at Section 5 of this specification
Quotations are invited for the Inter Country Adoption Pre-Assessment Service, in accordance with the attached terms and conditions of the council.

1.	The Service will be provided for the following Local Authorities, whether or not services are delivered through a Regional Adoption Agency at the commencement of the contract or in the future:

•	Blackburn with Darwen Council
•	Blackpool Council
•	Bolton Council
•	Bury Council
•	Cheshire East Council
•	Cheshire West and Chester Council
•	Cumbria County Council
•	Halton Borough Council
•	Knowsley Council
•	Liverpool City Council
•	Manchester City Council
•	Oldham Council
•	Rochdale Borough Council
•	Salford City Council
•	Sefton Council
•	St Helens Council
•	Stockport Metropolitan Borough Council
•	Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council
•	Trafford Council
•	Warrington Borough Council
•	Wigan Council
•	Wirral Council 
To provide a Pre-Assessment Inter Country Adoption Service Users on behalf of the Local Authorities (stipulated in Section 5 of the attached specification) who are represented at the North West Adoption Leadership Board, including by a Regional Adoption Agency.

The service will include advice, information and counselling to Service Users seeking to adopt a child(ren) from outside the United Kingdom. This will include parents, guardians and relatives who wish to adopt a child(ren) from overseas.  Any services purchased will only be from the range of services the Provider is registered to provide.

Title: Children's Social Care Adviser
Description: DfE wishes to appoint an Adviser to provide intervention and improvement support in Tameside Metropolitan Borough Council. The Adviser will provide a clear and sustained focus on the areas for improvement and ensure independent oversight of progress in line with improvement plans. In doing so the Adviser is expected to supervise the programme of change that the Council has embarked on, to drive forward the improvements and implement close monitoring arrangements. They will bring their extensive and proven skills in children's social care transformation to deliver the programme of change to services for the most vulnerable children within the local context.
Additional Text: Value of the contract is up to maximum of £34.560 including VAT.
